alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 2:18PM EDT until June 27 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 217 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stoddartsville, or 12 miles southeast of Wilkes-Barre, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Blakeslee, Lake Harmony and Arrowhead Lake. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 91 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 290. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
